Articles.Content: What's the most science you've gotten in one single mission? Mine won't be impressive but I've managed 170+ from a moon mission. Yeah I know not impressive but it's a start. Lol

now

is something O_O amazing guy Edited January 8, 2014 by JiWint
Not me, but take a look at this:

Not me, but take a look at this:

That's a pretty awesome mission, I wonder why he disabled ratings and comments on that vid, cos I wanted to give it a like! (as I'm sure others would have).

Most points I've got in a single mission was my 3rd and final career mission which brought back 8646.3 points.

('m going to make a vid of my 3 mission career shortly, just not have time to edit it yet).
Most so far is 4583, from a Minmus mission:

Something above 3000 for the usual multi-landing Minmus spiel (Some data was transmitted, pretty sure I had close to zero science when the mission started):

It's sort of boring. Only interesting bit was when I undocked the lander, noticed I had forgotten to refuel, looked at the DV left, thought "screw it, that's enough"... it wasn't really. Made it back to orbit fine, but the entire rendezvous had to be done on RCS.

About 4500 from a mun, Minmus and gilly mission.

A fuel depo around the mun and Minmus to sap the biomes and enough deltaV to get to gilly, land and come back.
~9000 from minimus grinding recently. i did a mun grind for more points but i just don't recall
642.7 points for a simple orbit of Minmus, landing on the flats near the slopes, an EVA over to the slopes to grab a sample (forgot to do a crew report >.< ), then fly home.
Over 5k from a Duna/Ike return. Only top-tier I had unlocked was the gravity sensor.

Some missions will bring in boatloads of science. Jool system exploration is one good example.

Rover on Mun or Minmus is another, this can be expanded if you return to mothership in orbit to refuel and land on other biomes.

Downside is that many of the huge missions is that it might often be more effective to do multiple small missions, return the science and build a more capable ship the next time.

Not me, but take a look at this:

That was... amazing. Epic. No words! Supercalifragilisticexpelaidocius!

now
is something O_O amazing guy

This was so incredible. Why on Earth he disabled comments on this gem is beyond me! If I launch and land a single probe successfully without Mechjeb (please don't scorn me) it's a glorious victory.

I'm conducting a Grand Tour at the moment, it uses the maxed out tech tree, and several mods, AND is done in 0.22, AND it uses planet factory, but with just visiting Kerbin, Mun, Minmus, Eve, and Gilly, the old science overview mod estimates about 22000 science over the 300 experiments already taken on the ship and it's five landers.
